# Key Facts & Metrics for Hobbyists

This document contains the most exciting and accessible metrics for developers and hobbyists looking to use our technology.

### Unicorn Amanuensis (Transcription)
- **The Headline:** Transcribe a **1-hour meeting in 1.2 seconds**.
- **The Tech:** Uses the AMD NPU on modern Ryzen laptops.
- **What You Can Do:** Build tools to instantly transcribe all your university lectures, personal voice notes, or community meetups.
- **Cool Feature:** Comes with word-level timestamps and speaker labels out-of-the-box.

### Unicorn Orator (Text-to-Speech)
- **The Headline:** Get **cloud-quality voice** on your laptop without an internet connection.
- **The Tech:** Uses the integrated Intel GPU you already have.
- **What You Can Do:** Make your Python scripts talk. Build a custom voice assistant, create an audiobook from a text file, or make a game character speak.
- **Cool Feature:** It's **3-5x faster** than running on the CPU and uses less battery.

### Meeting Ops API
- **The Headline:** Access a full-featured meeting intelligence platform through a simple REST API.
- **The Tech:** A robust FastAPI backend.
- **What You Can Do:** Build a custom dashboard to track your meeting stats, create a Slack bot that automatically posts meeting summaries, or pull transcripts into your own note-taking app.
- **Cool Feature:** The API includes WebSocket endpoints for getting live transcription data as it happens.

### Center-Deep API (RAG)
- **The Headline:** Let your application **chat with its own documents**.
- **The Tech:** A simple API powered by a Qdrant vector database.
- **What You Can Do:** Build a chatbot that can answer questions about a specific PDF, create a personal search engine for your notes, or add a "related documents" feature to your blog.
- **Cool Feature:** You can upload a document and have it indexed and searchable with just two API calls.
